page.title: 10Market day in Flint
page.content: According to local history, the{first {market}held in Flint was granted by King Edward 1 in{1279}and was held each Thursday. The market flourished well until the{second world war.}In {1956}the town council decided to bring back the market. The same council now runs a{successful and friendly} open-air market each Friday in the town square. There are dozens of stalls{selling a {variety of goods from fish, fruit to {clothes and carpets.}Some traders are local but others come from Liverpool and Manchester. During our class visit we interviewed my neighbour Mrs. Probert who was selling fresh fish. She explained that the{rent depended on the length of the {frontage}of each stall. We also met a few boys who had left the secondary school, most of them were unemployed.
